bios: ['Neerja Sethi cofounded IT consulting and outsourcing firm Syntel with her husband Bharat Desai in 1980 in their apartment in Troy, Michigan.', 'French IT firm Atos SE bought Syntel for $3.4 billion in October 2018. Sethi got an estimated $510 million for her stake. ', 'Sethi, who had served as an executive at Syntel since 1980, did not join Atos after the acquisition.  ', 'Sethi met her husband in the U.S. while working for pioneering IT firm Tata Consulting Services, which they attempted to emulate.', 'The couple started the business with an initial investment of just $2,000.']
abouts: ['Sethi holds an undergraduate degree in mathematics, a masters degree in computer science and an MBA in operations research.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Shin Dong-guk is the founder of auto-parts manufacturer Hanyang Precision.', 'The bulk of his fortune however comes from his investment in pharmaceutical company, Hanmi, headed by his friend, Lim Sung-ki. ', 'Outside of the Lim family, Shin is second largest shareholder of Hanmi Pharmaceuticals and Hanmi Science.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Edgar Sia II is the chairman of DoubleDragon Properties, the real estate developer he and his partner Tony Tan Caktiong took public in 2014.', 'The company has been developing commercial and residential properties and reportedly plans to build 100 malls by 2020. ', 'Sia took his grocery chain MerryMart public in June 2020.', 'An aspiring architect, Sia dropped out of college to start Filipino fast-food label Mang Inasal. ', 'Sia sold a stake in Mang Inasal to Tan Caktiong in 2012.']
abouts: ['His father is part Chinese and his mother is part Japanese. ']

name: Billionaires
title: Investor
bios: ['Michael S. Smith built Freeport LNG, a $15 billion complex on the Texas coast that chills and exports liquefied natural gas. ', 'He made his first fortune with oil and gas company Basin Exploration, which he sold in 2001 for $428 million. ', 'Enjoys homes in Miami Beach, Malibu and the Hamptons. ', 'Freeport LNG was originally envisioned as an LNG import terminal; when the shale gas boom arrived, Smith turned his strategy 180 degrees. ']
abouts: ['He majored in chemistry at Colorado State University but dropped out just 6 credits shy of a degree to focus on skiing. Later donated $13 million. ']

name: Billionaires
bios: ["Su Rubo is a former executive director and long-time executive of Country Gardens, one of China's largest real estate developers.", 'He resigned from the board in April 2017.', 'He holds a degree in economic management from Jinan University.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ["Sun Xishuang and his main business, Dalian Yifang, are business partners of fellow Chinese billionaire Wang Jianlin's Wanda Group.", 'Dalian Yifang and Wanda have collaborated on resorts at Changbai Mountain in northern China and in the Xishuangbanna rainforest in the south.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Sehat Sutardha cofounded semiconductor company Marvell Technology with his wife, Weili Dai, in 1995.', 'He was CEO of the company until he and Dai were forced out in 2016 amid an internal accounting investigation.', 'No evidence of fraud was found in the Marvell accounting investigation.', 'The couple moved to Las Vegas in 2017 and have been investing in real estate and technology.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Susanto Suwarto cofounded Elang Mahkota Teknologi (Emtek), which was established in 1983 as a provider of PC services and computer equipment.', "Today Emtek's businesses include IT solutions, media and telecom. ", "Suwarto is commissioner at Emtek as well as at some of the company's subsidiaries. ", 'With a degree in electronics and telecom engineering, Suwarto gets his wealth from a minority stake in Emtek.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Tan Eng Kee is the cofounder and CEO of Malaysia-listed Greatech Technology, a maker of factory automation equipment.', "He set up the company in 1997 with his school buddy, Khor Lean Heng, who's the company's COO.", "Greatech's customers include EV makers, solar energy producers and semiconductor companies. ", 'The company, which listed in 2019, has eight factories and a testing facility in the U.S., one of its biggest markets.']
abouts: ["At age 16, Tan worked part-time at a bakery after school hours to supplement his family's income."]

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Tan Yu Wei gets his wealth from his stake in Mr. D.I.Y, a home improvement retail chain, which his older brother, Tan Yu Yeh founded in 2005.', 'Tan Yu Wei was a director at De Little Chinatown, a wholesaler of Chinese products, until 2011 when he joined D.I.Y.', 'The company was listed on the Malaysian stock exchange in October 2020.', 'Mr. D.I.Y has 684 stores in Malaysia and four stores in Brunei.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ["Yoshikazu Tanaka's company Gree develops free-to-play mobile and social-network-based games. ", 'He founded the company in 2004 and took it public in 2008.', "Tanaka is the company's chairman and CEO; he owns a substantial stake."]

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Hary Tanoesoedibjo got his start building a media business soon after college; he still owns more than 60 TV stations, radio stations and a newspaper.', 'He stepped down as CEO of his Media Nusantara Citra (MNC), which owns four national TV stations, in 2016 to focus on politics.', "Via his listed firm MNC Land, he is building resorts in Bali and Java that will be managed by Donald Trump's company. ", 'His daughter Angela Herliani Tanoesoedibjo is deputy tourism and creative economy minister.']
abouts: ["Hary, who attended Donald Trump's inauguration, is building a Trump Hotel luxury resort in Bali.", "Hary is now actively involved in his political party Perindo, which he founded in 2014 after a brief run to be the country's vice president. "]

name: Billionaires
bios: ["Mehmet Sinan Tara is chairman of one of Turkey's largest construction and energy companies, ENKA. It was cofounded by his father, Sarik Tara, in 1957.", "Turkey's leading private electricity producer, ENKA also operates in real estate, tourism, transport and trade (construction equipment and machinery).", 'In Moscow, ENKA owns a hotel, shopping malls and approximately 370,000 square meters of net rentable Class A office space.', "Sarik Tara's brother-in-law Sadi Gulcelik, with whom he founded ENKA, died in a plane accident in Saudi Arabia in 1980.", 'Sinan Tara took over management of ENKA in 1984 when he was only 26 years old. His son Agah Mehmet Tara became CEO in 2012, at age 29.']
abouts: ['Over the last 20 years or so, ENKA has been the biggest builder of U.S. consular and embassy buildings.', 'Spanning the globe, these projects can be found in locations ranging from Turkey, Algeria and Nepal to Equatorial Guinea, the Dominican Republic and the Netherlands.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Shirou Terashita is president and CEO  of investor and shareholder relations firm IR Japan Holdings.', 'He joined the firm in 1982, eventually conducting a management buyout in 2008. ', "It was listed on Tokyo's JASDAQ bourse in 2011 and moved to the Tokyo Stock Exchange in 2018. ", 'The company posted nearly $75 million in revenue in the fiscal year ended in March 2020 and about $24 million in net profit.', 'IR Japan has advised Japanese companies in proxy fights with activist investors.']

name: Billionaires
title: Investor
bios: ['A co-founder of private equity firm Thoma Bravo, Carl Thoma is one of the deans of the buyout business.', "A graduate of Oklahoma State University and the Stanford's business school, Thoma cofounded GTCR in 1980 and then split from the firm in 1998.", "Created Thoma Cressey in 1998 and hired a young dealmaker, Orlando Bravo, who would go on to build the firm's software strategy.", 'Thoma and Bravo split from Cressey in 2008. Since, software-focused Thoma Bravo has posted top returns and grown to $39 billion in assets.', "Thoma's family foundation is a major patron of the arts. A recent initiative is to provide free admission to the Museum of Contemporary Art in Cleveland."]
abouts: ["Carl and Marilynn Thoma met at Oklahoma State. They are avid collectors of art and wine aficionados, operating a vineyard in Oregon's Willamette Valley."]
bio: A co-founder of private equity firm Thoma Bravo, Carl Thoma is one deans of the buyout business. A graduate of Oklahoma State University and the Stanford Graduate School of Business, Thoma helped create GTCR in 1980 and then split from the firm in 1998, forming Thoma Cressey. The firm became Thoma Bravo in 2008 and is now a wildly successful software-oriented firm with $36 billion in assets. Thoma and his wife Marilynn are avid art collectors, with works dating to the 17th century up to modern and contemporary art. Since 1998, they've also operated the Van Duzer vineyard in the Willamette Valley of Oregon.

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Tseng Sing-ai inherited her Chang Chun Group stake from her father, Tseng Shin-yi, who died in 2016.', 'Shin-yi co-founded the business in 1949 with classmates M.K. Liao and Lin Shu-Hong. ', "Chang Chun is now one of Asia's largest petrochemicals-and-plastics manufacturers, with plants in Taiwan, China and Southeast Asia.", 'Sing-ai serves as a supervisor at the board of directors at Chang Chun Plastics.  ']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Sunil Vachani is the founder and chairman of India-listed Dixon Technologies.', 'Vachani borrowed two million rupees ($27,600) from his father to set up the company in 1993 to manufacture TV sets.', 'The company makes products such as smartphones, washing machines and TVs, for a range of clients including Samsung, Panasonic and Xiaomi.', 'The company listed in 2017 and its shares have been rising ever since.']

name: Billionaires
bios:
['Jan Van Geet is the founder and CEO of VGP, a Belgian real estate company.', 'VGP specializes in developing industrial office parks, with properties in 12 European countries. 
', 'Van Geet founded the company in 1998 in the former Czech Republic.
', 'He currently owns about a third of the publicly-traded company, which listed its shares in 2007. 
', 'A passionate equestrian, his hobby is dressage. 
']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Sekar Vembu get his wealth from his holding in privately held Zoho, which offers business software on the cloud.', 'He cofounded AdventNet, the precursor to Zoho, along with his two brothers as well as three other friends. ', 'In 2002, he set up Vembu Technologies in Chennai, which offers data backup and disaster recovery solutions to small and medium firms.', 'His brother Sridhar is the face of the company, while Sekar keeps a low profile. ', 'His sister Radha Vembu is the largest shareholder in Zoho and also a billionaire.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ["Wang Han's wealth mainly comes from shares in Juneyao Air that he inherited from his deceased father Wang Junyao, the founder of Juneyao Group.", 'Juneyao also has business interests in retailing, education and food. ']

name: Billionaires
bios: ["Wang's fortune arises from a stake in Smoore International, a supplier of vaping devices.", 'Smoore supplies components for vaping devices to Japan Tobacco, British American Tobacco and NJOY.', 'Smoore went public in Hong Kong in 2020.', 'Smoore CEO Chen Zhiping is also a member of the 2021 Forbes Billionaires List.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Wang is vice chairman of Yantai Jereh Oilfield Services Group,a supplier of oil exploration equipment. ', "Jerehis headquartered in the coastal city of Yantai in China's Shandong Province.", 'Jereh is founded by in 1999 by its chairman Sun Weijie, who is also a member of the 2021 Forbes Billionaires List.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ["Wen Pengcheng chairs Guangdong Wen's Foodstuffs Group of China, which sells and breeds chicken. \r\n", 'More than 50,000  family farms work with Wen.\r\n']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Wen Yibo, a former government engineer, leads Shenzhen-listed Sound Environmental Resources and Hong Kong-listed Sound Global.\r\n', "Wen holds a degree in environmental engineering from Langzhou Jiaotong University and a master's in the same field from Tsinghua University. \r\n"]

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Anne Marie Werninghaus is the largest individual shareholder of WEG, the largest manufacturer of electrical motors in Latin America.', 'The company was cofounded by her grandfather Geraldo Werninghaus along with late billionaires Eggon Joao da Silva and Werner Ricardo Voigt.', 'A publicly-traded multinational with factories in five countries, WEG had revenues of US $3.05 billion in 2020.', "Anne doesn't work at the company or hold a board seat; she is the founder of VestesBr, a short-lived B2B fashion marketplace launched in 2011. ", "Anne is married and currently lives quietly in Joinville, a Brazilian city where Germans once settled, not far from WEG's headquarters."]

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Dan and his brother Farris got a combined $3.5 billion (pretax) in 2011 selling their fracking company to a group led by Singapore-based firm Temasek.', "The brothers have acquired more than 672,000 acres of land in six different states across the West, becoming America's 12th-largest landowners.", "They first founded Wilks Masonry in 1995, following in their stone mason father's footsteps.", 'In 2002 they went into fracking, launching Frac Tech and growing it into an oil and natural gas giant before cashing out less than a decade later.', 'The brothers are also investing in oil and gas businesses, including Canadian oilfield services company Trican Well Service.']
abouts: ['Like his brother, Dan is a GOP financial backer, donating millions to Republican Super PACs during the 2016 election cycle.', 'The brothers reportedly spend four months a year in Montana, working on building homes on their  large ranches.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Wong chairs Good First Group, a real estate developer headquartered in Xiamen.', "Good First Group was founded by Chen Zhanghui, Wong's husband, who passed away in 2000.", 'Wong was reportedly a math teacher before she joined the business. ', 'She also holds a stake in China-listed real estate developer Datang. ']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Wong Hong King is the controlling shareholder of Hong Kong-listed LVGEM China Real Estate Investment. ', "LVGEM was founded in 1995. Wong's daughter is chairman and his son is executive director. "]

name: Billionaires
bios:
['Wu is the chairman of central Taiwan auto-parts-maker Fine Blanking.
', 'Most of his fortune comes from the 2007 sale of a stake he owned in Hong Kong-listed beverage-and instant-noodle-maker Tingyi.', 'Also known as Tony.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ["Eddie Wu is the president of Alibaba Group, China's largest e-commerce company. ", 'His wealth arises from his holding in Alibaba financial services affiliate Ant Group. ', "China held up Ant's planned dual listing in Shanghai and Hong Kong on regulatory concerns on November 3, 2020. "]

name: Billionaires
bios: ["Wu is the founder of Shin Kong Financial, one of Taiwan's largest private-sector financial companies.", "Wu stepped down as the firm's chairman in June 2020, after 18 years at the helm. ", 'A third brother, Thomas, runs an unrelated financial-services firm, Taishin Financial, and is also a billionaire.', "Eugene Wu's late father, Wu Ho-Su, built a fortune in trading and textiles starting in the 1940s."]

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Wu Wei chairs China East Education, one of the largest providers of vocational training in China.', 'China East went public on the Hong Kong Stock Exchange in 2019.', 'China East focuses its courses on culinary arts, IT and auto services. ', 'Wu Wei holds and EMBA from the Tsinghua University School of Economics and Management in Beijing.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Xiao Guoqing is an executive director at China East Education, one of the largest providers of vocational training in China.', 'Xiao is the cousin of company chairman, Wu Wei.', 'Xiao Guoqing holds a degree in business administration from Renmin University in Beijing. ']

name: Billionaires
residenceMsa: New York-Jersey City-White Plains, NY-NJ Metropolitan Division
bios: ['George Yancopoulos is the chief scientific officer of biotech firm Regeneron. ', 'He received his M.D. and Ph.D. from Columbia University and became a professor of biology by age 28.  ', 'Regeneron was cofounded by now-billionaire Leonard Schleifer in 1988. Yancopoulos joined the next year.', 'Yancopoulos led the invention of seven approved drugs and a technology platform designed to invent more.', 'Yancopoulos owns about 2% of Regeneron stock.']
abouts: ['Yancopoulos was the first pharmaceutical research chief to become a billionaire.', 'Yancopoulos was a finalist in the Westinghouse Science Talent Search in 1976. Today, its called the Regeneron Science Talent Search and is sponsored by his company.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Yao is a director of Maxscend Microelectronics, a supplier of smartphone radio frequency switches.', 'Maxscend Microelectronics was founded in 2012 by a group of Silicon Valley alums.', "Yao holds a master's degree from the Chinese Academy of Sciences. "]

name: Billionaires
bios:
['Yu Faxiang chairs Sunriver Holding Group, which was founded as a tourism business in in Hainan in 1992. \r\n', 'Sunriver Holding has stakes in animation company Zhejiang Sunriver Culture and highway construction firm Gourgen Traffic Construction.', "Sunriver Holding has 5,000 employees with the total asset of 45 billion yuan, or $6.4 billion, according to the company's website.
"]

name: Billionaires
bios: ["Yuan Jinhua is one of four founders of Sany Group, one of China's largest supplier of construction equipment.", 'Sany was founded in Hunan Province in 1989 as a small welding material factory.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Igor Yusufov is the founder of Energy Corporation, which invests in oil and gas, mining and infrastructure companies.', 'In the early 1990s, Yusufov was a deputy secretary of Foreign Economic Relations.', "From 2001 to 2004, he was the Russian Federation's energy minister.", 'He also served on the board Russian gas giant Gazprom from 2003 to 2013.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Zan Shengda chairs investment company Nantong Zongyi Investment. \r\n', 'Zan holds an EMBA degree from Tsinghua University.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Zeng chairs Redsun Properties Group, a real estate developer. ', 'Redsun went public in Hong Kong in 2018.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Zhang chairs Yanker Shop Food, a supplier of snack food. ', 'Yanker is headquartered in the southeastern Chinese city of Changsha. ']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Zhang Yuxiang is the chairman of Nanjids (Shanghai), a supplier of knitwear. ', 'Nanjids was known as Nanjiren until it changed its name in 2015.', 'The business was founded in Shanghai in 1998.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Zhao Tongtong is a co-founder of Huazhu Group, a hotel chain in China.', "She's also a board member of China Education & Technology Group.", 'Zhao holds a MBA from McGill University.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Tony Zhao is CEO of Agora, an online video and voice communication platform.', 'Agora began trading on the Nasdaq in 2020.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Zhong Peifeng is chairman of Amlogic Shanghai, a microchip supplier.', "Zhong holds a master's degree from Georgia Institute of Technology."]

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Zhou Ping as a maintenance factory worker before he started his first business -- a catering company -- in 1990 at age 28.', 'Zhou entered the sanitation business through EIT Environmental Development Group in Shenzhen with six people in 1997.', 'Today EIT has more than 60,000 staff and business in more than 80 cities in China. ', 'Services include municipal, airport, school, and office sanitation.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Zhou chairs Beijing Kunlun Tech, a Beijing-headquartered operator of online games. ', "Zhou holds a master's degree from China's elite Tsinghua University. "]

name: Billionaires
bios: ['In the early 1990s Boris Zingarevich and his business partner Zakhar Smuskhin got involved in barter trading with Russian pulp and paper mills.', "Later that decade, during the country's privatization phase, they bought their first plant, the Kotlas pulp and paper mill.", "The partners' Ilim Group formed a joint venture in 2007 with multinational firm International Paper; the venture operates in Russia as Ilim Group.", 'As part of the deal, International Paper purchased 50% of Ilim for approximately $650 million, most of which was cash.', 'Zingarevich also controls Ilim Timber, a large Russian processed timber firm.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ["Ahmet Nazif Zorlu presides over one of Turkey's biggest corporate groups, operating in textiles, real estate, energy, mining and consumer durables.", 'His father, Haci Mehmet Zorlu, laid the foundation for Zorlu Holding in 1953 by starting a business weaving bed sheets on a homemade loom.', 'In the 1960s, Ahmet and brother Zeki grew the retail side of the business, initiated contract manufacturing and launched the home textiles brand TAC.', 'Zorlu entered the energy business in 1993 to power its textile production, then diversified into natural gas distribution, solar and other activities.', 'It makes Vestel-branded consumer electronics and appliances, and the domestic Venus cell phone.']
abouts: ['As a child, Ahmet started selling the fabrics he produced himself. He opened his first shop in Trabzon. He is a high school dropout.', 'He shuttles around Europe in a custom helicopter and owns a private island, Zeytin Adas (Olive Island), in the Aegean Sea off the Turkish coast.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['A. Jayson "Jay" Adair is the CEO of Dallas-based Copart, a leader in online auctions for used and totaled cars.', "He joined the company in 1989 at age 19 as a manager; Copart's founder, Willis Johnson, is Adair's father-in-law.", "Adair pioneered Copart's move into online auctions in 1998, and by 2003, the company eliminated in-person bids and put auctions 100% online.", "He took over as Copart's CEO in 2010 after Johnson stepped down and now owns about 4% of the company's stock.", "As CEO, Adair expanded Copart's physical footprint to 243 locations in 11 countries."]
abouts: ['Adair owns a vineyard in Suisun Valley wine country in northern California.', 'In 1996, Adair and Johnson bought the Internet domain name Copart.com -- they also tried to buy IAA.com as a joke on their biggest rival, but it was taken.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Albert Avdolyan owns Far East and Siberian coal mining and gas companies alongside state-owned conglomerate Rostec.', 'Avdolyan got the investment capital from selling stakes in the Russian telecommunications companies Megafon and Yota.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Baiju Bhatt cofounded no-fee stock trading app Robinhood in 2013 with his friend Vlad Tenev.', 'Bhatt was co-CEO of Robinhood until November 2020, when he stepped down from that position. ', "Since its launch, Robinhood's no-commission trading model has revolutionized the brokerage industry.", 'In August 2020, private investors valued Robinhood at more than $11 billion in a fundraising round.', "Bhatt owns an estimated 10.5% stake in Robinhood; Forbes applies a discount to the private company's valuation."]
abouts: ['In December 2020, Robinhood agreed to pay $65 million to the Securities and Exchange Commission to settle charges of deceiving customers about its revenue source.', "Bhatt's parents emigrated from India to the U.S., where he was born and raised; He met Tenev at Stanford University."]

name: Billionaires
bios: ["Math whiz worked for IBM on NASA's Saturn rockets in the 1960s. ", 'Founded pioneering high-speed-trading outfit Quantlab, which at one point moved 3% of volumes on the NYSE. ', "According to court documents, Quantlab generated more than $2 billion in net profits over the past 15 years. Ed's 72% stake is held via trusts. ", 'Bosarge is the beneficiary of trusts, domiciled in South Dakota, that according to court filings hold assets of more than $1 billion. ', 'A proponent of stem cell therapies, Bosarge sponsored a symposium at the Vatican, after which the church came out in favor of research on adult stem cells. ']
abouts: ['Over Yonder Cay, his 72-acre private island in the Bahamas, runs entirely on renewable energy. ']
bio: Founder of high-speed trading pioneer Quantlab, which at one point moved 3% of volumes on the NYSE. Is in the midst of a fractious divorce from wife Marie, who claims Ed has evaded taxes on "billions and billions" of profits deposited into trusts offshore and in South Dakota. Math whiz worked on NASA's Saturn project in the 1960s. Got into quantitative trading; hit by the SEC in 1983 for manipulating stocks. Aficionado of stem cell therapies.

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Ina Chan is recognized as the third wife of the late casino kingpin Stanley Ho and mother to three of his children, Florinda, Laurinda and Orlando. ', "Born in Macau, Chan owns stakes in casino operator SJM and STDM, Ho's previous Macau investment vehicle.", 'She also has a stake in casino and hospitality company Macau Legend, where her daughter Laurinda Ho is a director. ', 'Chan met Ho as a nurse hired to care of his first wife, Clementina Leitão, who was disabled following a car accident in 1971.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Chang Byung-gyu is chairman of online gaming company Krafton (formerly known as Bluehole), which he founded in 2007. ', 'In 2018 Tencent invested more than $500 million in the company for a 10% stake, catapulting Bluehole to unicorn status overnight. ', "Its shooter game, PlayerUnknown's Battlegrounds, broke a world record in 2017 after posting $100 million in pre-release sales in just 79 days. "]

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Chung Mong-joon is the largest shareholder of shipbuilder Hyundai Heavy Industries. ', 'He is the sixth son of the late Hyundai group founder Chung Ju-yung, who got his start repairing trucks for the U.S. Army after the Korean War.', 'Chung ran Hyundai Heavy Industries until he entered politics in 1988; he served seven terms in the National Assembly.']
abouts: ['In 2014 he ran for mayor of Seoul but lost.', 'He is a former vice president of international soccer body FIFA. ']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Carmen Daurella owns nearly 4% of bottling company Coca-Cola European Partners, the largest independent Coke bottler by revenue.', 'Coca-Cola European Partners was formed in 2016 as a merger of Coke bottling companies from Spain, Germany and Coca-Cola Enterprises.', 'Coca-Cola partnered with the Daurella family of Spain in the early 1950s to create its first bottling plant in Barcelona.', "Carmen Daurella's husband Mario Rotllant Sola is a member of the board of Coca-Cola European Partners. ", 'Her cousin Sol Daurella, also a billionaire, is chair of Coca-Cola European Partners']

name: Billionaires
bios: ["GT Dave started brewing kombucha in his parents' Bel Air kitchen at 16 years old in 1995. ", "He became the first to commercialize the fizzy drink, pioneering what's now one of the hottest categories in beverage. ", "Today, GT's Kombucha controls around 40% of the U.S. kombucha market, generating an estimated $275 million in annual sales. ", 'Unlike his investor-backed competitors today, Dave still owns 100% of his company and has diversified into other drinks like CBD water.']
abouts: ['Dave never went to college and left high school early with a GED, after falling in with a crowd of rich kids with a taste for drugs. ', 'Kombucha, an ancient fermented tea used by travelers along the Silk Road, earned a following during the AIDS epidemic as a supposed immune-booster.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Delhi-based Mukand Lal Dua and his younger brother Ramesh Kumar Dua, also a billionaire, get their wealth from a majority stake in Relaxo Footwears.', 'The $320 million (revenue) company is known for affordable brands such as Sparx (sports shoes), Bahamas (flip flops) and Schoolmate (school shoes).', 'The company has eight factories with the capacity to produce 750,000 pairs a day.', "Dua's son, Nikhil, has a board seat in the company."]
abouts: ["Bollywood stars Salman Khan and Akshay Kumar are Relaxo's brand ambassadors."]

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Delhi-based Ramesh Kumar Dua and his brother Mukand Lal Dua, also a billionaire, get their wealth from a majority stake in Relaxo Footwears.', 'The $320 million (revenue) company is known for affordable brands such as Sparx (sports shoes), Bahamas (flip flops) and Schoolmate (school shoes).', 'Dua joined the family business of manufacturing bicycle parts and footwear in 1974. Today he runs the company as managing director.', 'The company has eight factories with the capacity to produce 750,000 pairs a day.']
abouts: ['Ramesh Kumar Dua is a London-trained rubber technologist.', "Bollywood stars Salman Khan and Akshay Kumar are Relaxo's brand ambassadors."]

name: Billionaires
bios: ['José Elías is chairman of Audax Renovables, a renewable energy company based in Spain that produces wind and solar energy.', 'He owns about 65% of the Madrid-listed company, which has wind farms in Spain, France and Poland.', 'The company is developing solar projects in Spain, Portugal and Italy.', 'He is also largest shareholder of Aspy Global Services, a listed firm that provides occupational health and safety services']

name: Billionaires
title: Cofounder, CEO
bios: ["Larry Fink is the founder, CEO and chairman of powerhouse investment management firm BlackRock, one of the world's largest asset managers.", 'He and seven partners founded BlackRock in 1988. Originally it was part of The Blackstone Group.', 'BlackRock was spun off from Blackstone in 1994 and went public in 1999.  ', 'Today Blackrock has $8.7 trillion in assets under management. ', 'Before starting BlackRock, Fink was a managing director at The First Boston Corporation. ']

name: Billionaires
bios: ["Horst-Otto Gerberding owns 5% of Symrise AG, one of the world's largest makers of ingredients for fragrances, flavors, nutrients and cosmetics.", 'Symrise resulted from the 2003 merger of Dragoco and Haarmann & Reimer.', 'Founded in 1919 by Carl-Wilhelm Gerberding in Holzminden, Germany, Dragoco started out producing formulations for perfume and soap.', 'Horst-Otto serves on the advisory board of Symrise, which employs more than 10,000 people and has annual revenue of around $4 billion.', "He's also majority owner and chairman of the advisory board of Gottfried Friedrichs GmbH & Co. KG, a fish-products company based in Hamburg."]
abouts: ['He holds a BA in Business Administration from Western Washington University in Bellingham, WA.', 'Together with his wife, Kirsten, he founded Courage - Die Gerberding Stiftung, a foundation focused on youth education, sports and civic engagement.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Gim Seong-gon is the chairman of CS Wind, a maker of wind towers, which he founded in 1988. ', 'In 2008, Goldman Sachs invested around $40 million in the company, allowing it to expand into other markets. ', 'CS Wind now has operations in China, Indonesia, Korea, Malaysia, Taiwan, Turkey and Vietnam. ', 'Gim, who grew up poor, worked at a local construction company and opted to be stationed in its Saudi Arabia branch for a higher salary. ', 'He later set up a trading company for construction materials in Saudi Arabia before his foray into wind towers. ']

name: Billionaires
bios: ["Gou Yiqun's fortune arises from shareholdings in hot-pot chain Haidilao International Holdings and hotpot seasonings supplier Yihai International.", 'Haidilao, founded in 1994, is today one of the most popular restaurant chains in China.', 'Haidilao had 935 restaurants in China, Singapore, U.S., South Korea, Japan, Canada,the UK, Malaysia, Vietnam,Indonesia and Australia as of mid-2020.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Clelia Haji-Ioannou is the daughter of Loucas Haji-Ioannou, the late Greek Cypriot shipping magnate (d. 2008).', 'She is a billionaire thanks to her stake in discount airline easyJet, founded by her brother Stelios.', 'Clelia owns approximately $80 million worth of real estate across Europe, including properties in Monaco and Greece.', 'She also has a gallery outside of Athens featuring artwork by Picasso, Warhol and Dali.']
abouts: ['Haji-Ioannou oversaw the publication of a biography of her father, "Loucas Haji-Ioannou: The King of the Tankers." ', 'Born in Athens, Clelia Haji-Ioannou holds both Cypriot and British citizenship and sits on the board of the Cyprus Marine Environment Protection Association. ']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Hang Hong is a director of Wuxi Shangji Automation, a supplier of precision equipment for the photovoltaics industry.', 'Hang Hong cofounded Shangji with husband Yang Jianliang in 2002 and is a director now.', 'Husband Ynag Jianliang is chairman and president of Wuxi Shangji Automation.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ["Ronnen Harary is the cofounder and co-CEO of Spin Master Corp., known for its popular kids' toys like Hatchimals, Air Hogs and Paw Patrol.  ", 'Harary started the company in 1994 with his childhood friend Anton Rabie.', 'Armed with $10,000, Rabie and Harary released Spin Master\'s first toy in 1994. It was called "Earth Buddy" and resembled a Chia Pet.', 'Spin Master had its IPO in 2015.  ', 'Spin Master is now a $1.2 billion (sales) company, which employs over 1,500 people in 16 countries.']
abouts: ['Rabie and Harary reportedly met at summer camp in Ontario when they were both 11 years old. ', "Spin Master made toys for the popular children's TV show, The Wiggles."]

name: Billionaires
title: Investor
employment: {'name': 'Winton Capital Management', 'title': 'Chairman & Head of Research', 'government': False, 'featuredExecutive': False}
bios: ['David Harding founded his hedge fund firm, Winton Group, in 1997 with less than $2 million. ', "The London-based company, whose moniker is taken from Harding's middle name, now manages nearly $20 billion and employs some 200 people.", 'Harding, who studied theoretical physics, uses a scientific approach when investing, including quantitative models to pick stocks.', 'Harding previously cofounded Adam, Harding and Leuck (AHL), a managed futures firm that he and his partners sold to hedge fund The Man Group in 1994.', 'His David and Claudia Harding Foundation is known for supporting academics and science. It gave about $125 million to Cambridge University in 2019.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Iceland-born David Helgason cofounded game engine company Unity Software in 2004 in Copenhagen, Denmark.', "Some of the world's most popular online and mobile games were built using Unity's engine, including Pokemon Go, Among Us and Overcooked.", 'In September 2020, Unity Software went public on the New York Stock Exchange; he owns a nearly 4% stake.', 'Helgason served as CEO from 2003 to 2014, and is still a board member, but spends most of his time as a venture capital investor.', 'Helgason and his cofounders started off creating a game that failed, but realized that their game engine had value for others.']
abouts: ['Helgason is one of just two billionaires from Iceland; the other is investor Thor Bjorgolfsson.', 'Helgason has a wide array of interests; he studied physics, Arabic, and psychology at the University of Copenhagen from 1997 to 2001.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Hou Jianbin is CEO of Zuoyebang, a China online services provider.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Hur Young-in is chairman of the SPC Group, a holding company with interests in bakeries and fast-service restaurants. ', 'Known as South Korea\'s "Franchise King," his company now has 1,800 Baskin-Robbins and Dunkin\' Donut stores. ', 'The SPC Group also runs Pascucci (Italian café), The World Vine (wine), Jamba Juice (smoothies) and New York burger house Shake Shack in Korea. ']
abouts: ['His Paris Baguette, a bakery café franchise brand, now has more than 3,000 stores globally, mostly in South Korea. ', "Hur took over as CEO of his father's company, Samlip General Foods, famous for its Cream Bun, in 1981."]

name: Billionaires
bios: ["Jiang Long is vice chairman and president of Goertek Inc., a maker of electronic components; Goerek's customers include Apple.", 'Jiang, who joined Goertek in 2004, holds a doctorate from the University of Maryland. ', 'Brother Jiang Bin, who founded Goertek in 2001, chairs the company.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Morris Kahn cofounded Amdocs, a customer-relationship management-and-billing software firm for large telecom outfits. ', 'He sold nearly $1 billion worth of shares after Admocs went public in 1998.', 'A South African native, he lives on the Israeli coast and spends much of his time on a 100-foot yacht.', 'Through his Aurum Ventures, Morris invests in life sciences and clean-tech companies that he hopes will contribute to the wellbeing of the planet.', 'He currently serves as the chairman of SpaceIL, which attempted to send the first Israeli spacecraft to the moon in 2019.']
abouts: ['An avid diver, Kahn started building aquariums after a diving accident that gave him a burst eardrum, forcing him to stay on land for months. ']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Ashok Kajaria is the chairman and managing director of listed Kajaria Ceramics, which was founded by him in 1988.', "The company is India's largest manufacturer of ceramic tiles, which it manufactures in eight factories across the country.", 'Both his sons Chetan and Rishi help him run the company as joint managing directors.', "Bollywood actor Akshay Kumar is Kajaria's brand ambassador."]
abouts: ['Kajaria is a U.S.-educated mechanical engineer.', "The company's factories have a combined annual capacity to make more than 70 million square meters of tiles."]

name: Billionaires
bios: ['T.S. Kalyanaraman chairs Kalyan Jewellers, a gold jewelry chain with 137 stores spread across India and the Middle East.', 'The business has its origins in a century-old textile store established in south India by his grandfather, who hailed from a family of Hindu priests.', "Kalyanaraman worked in the family's textile trade from age 12 until 1993 when he started the jewelry chain. ", 'With revenues of $1.35 billion, the privately held company counts Warburg Pincus as a key investor. ', 'Kalyanaraman has expanded into real estate with Kalyan Developers, which has projects in south India.']
abouts: ['Kalyan shut down 8 stores in the Middle East during the pandemic.', 'He contributed $3 million to Habitat For Humanity India to build 2,000 homes for low-income families.']

name: Billionaires
title: Personality
bios: ['Social media queen Kardashian West has parlayed reality TV into an actual fortune, selling a mobile game, cosmetics and, now, shapewear.', 'The bulk of her wealth comes from her cosmetics and fragrance company KKW Beauty.', 'In 2020, she sold 20% of the company to Coty for $200 million.', 'She launched shapewear brand Skims in 2019.  Forbes estimates her majority stake is worth a conservative $225 million.', 'She launched Skims in 2019, an inclusive shapewear brand that raised $5 million from VC firm Imaginary Ventures.\r\n', 'In February 2021, Kardashian filed for divorce from husband Kanye West. The couple have four children.']
abouts: ['Kardashian West is an advocate for criminal justice reform, gun safety and cancer causes.', 'Kardashian has some of the most-followed social media pages in the world: 67 million on Twitter and 190 million on Instagram.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['David Katzman is the CEO of SmileDirectClub, which sells custom teeth aligners.', "Katzman's son and his son's friend started the company in 2014.", 'His investment firm, Camelot Venture Group, provided initial funding for SmileDirectClub.', 'Katzman had previously invested in direct-to-consumer companies like Quicken Loans and 1-800-Contacts.', 'SmileDirectClub went public in September 2019; Katzman remains the largest shareholder.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Bom Kim is the founder of e-commerce giant Coupang. ', "Mimicking U.S.-based Amazon, Coupang is disrupting South Korea's online retail space by slashing prices and investing heavily in swift deliveries.", "In November 2018, it raised $2 billion from Softbank's Vision Fund at a $9 billion valuation, making it Korea's most valuable privately-held startup. ", 'In March 2021 Kim took Coupang public on the New York Stock Exchange, marking the biggest listing of an Asian company since Alibaba in 2014. ', 'Kim worked at Boston Consulting Group before founding Vintage Media Company, which he sold in 2009. He started Coupang the next year.']
abouts: ['Kim is a graduate of Harvard University; He later attended Harvard Business School but dropped out after only six months.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Masatoshi Kumagai founded the predecessor to GMO Internet in 1991.', 'GMO, which is publicly traded, provides internet services to online brokerages, foreign exchange trading services and others.', 'GMO Internet is also creating smartphone games and has an identity protection business. ']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Lev Kvetnoi has invested in airports, airport services, banking and cement.', "Kvetnoi was the largest shareholder in Moscow's Vnukovo Airport, owning 30% of the project, until he sold out in 2013 and quit its board. ", "In 2011 he expanded his cement holdings by acquiring one of billionaire Elena Baturina's factories in southern Russia."]
abouts: ["For a time Kvetnoi served as chief executive of a company in billionaire Alisher Usmanov's metals group, but he sold out his interests to Usmanov in 2006. ", 'In the early 1990s, Kvetnoi traded computers with an army friend Andrei Skoch, who is now also billionaire.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Vladimir Leschikov owns more than 370 acres of land near the border between Moscow and New Moscow territory.', "That's where his shopping complex Slavyanskiy Mir (Slavic world), with a space of about 3 million square feet, is located.", 'Leschikov was born in Dagestan in the North Caucasus region.   ', 'Leschikov and his older brother moved to Moscow bought rooms in the center of Moscow to lease them.', "Moscow's government plans to build two metro stations on Leschikov's land.  "]

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Li is the largest shareholder of Niu Technologies, a supplier of e-scooters.', 'Li is a partner at Plum Investments in China.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Liu Qingfeng is the founder,chairman and president of Iflytek, a supplier of voice recognition software.', "Iflytek is headquartered in Heifei, the capital of China's Anhui Province. ", 'Iflytek went public at the Shenzhen Stock Exchange in 2008.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['In 1960, Jose Llado Fernandez-Urrutia founded Tecnicas Reunidas, a construction company he built into a multibillion-dollar business.', 'The Madrid-listed company has projects ranging from refineries in Turkey, Belgium and Russia to a seawater desalination plant in Australia.', "He served in Spain's government in the 1970s and as the country's ambassador to the United States from 1978 to 1982.", "He's also an art connoisseur, serving as a patron to Spain's Fundacion de Amigos del Museo del Prado since 1983 and Museo Reina Sofía since 2013.", 'In June 2020, he ceded his chairmanship of Tecnicas Reunidas to his son, Juan Lladó Arburúa.']
abouts: ['He holds a doctorate from University of Madrid in chemistry and industrial chemistry.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Kenneth Lo founded clothing manufacturer Crystal Group with his wife in 1970. ', "He built a modest sweater factory into one of Asia's largest garment manufacturers, with 68,000 employees at 20 sites around the world. ", "Crystal's customers include Fast Retailing, Gap, Abercrombie & Fitch, Nike, Adidas and Puma. ", 'Lo, whose fortune includes that of his wife and his son Andrew, is chairman of the group while Andrew is chief executive. ', 'He is the eldest son of the late textile magnate Law Ting-pong. His brother is fellow billionaire Law Kar Po.']
abouts: ['Lo published a memoir in 2016 that credits his fighting spirit and strong character to hardscrabble beginnings as the oldest of six children.', 'When he was a child, Lo and his father Law Ting-pong worked on a farm, and then odd jobs. He attended a Catholic school for the poor, where he got the name Kenneth.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Ma Hong chairs Raytron Technology, a supplier of infrared imaging and sensor in the eastern Chinese city of Yantai.', 'Ma Hong holds a doctorate from Huazhong University of Science & Technology.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ["Sergei Makhlai is co-owner of Togliattiazot, one of Russia's biggest producers of nitrogen fertilizers.", "In 2011 he became the head of Togliattiazot after his father, Vladimir Makhlai, stepped down as the company's CEO.", 'In May 2019, the Russian government opened an investigation against him and his father for large-scale fraud. In July that year, they were each sentenced in absentia to nine years in prison.', 'The Makhlais, who deny wrongdoing, do not live in Russia and have thus not served any time.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ["Rafique Malik's Metro Brands is a popular multi-brand footwear retailer with 568 stores across 131 cities in India.", 'The $187 million (revenue), privately held company is known for its brands such as Mochi, Metro and Walkway.', 'Farah Malik Bhanji, the second of his five daughters, runs the company as managing director and CEO.', 'The company also operates 136 Crocs stores for which its has the India franchise.']
abouts: ['Billionaire investor Rakesh Jhunjhunwala has a minority stake in Metro Brands.', 'Metro was founded in 1947 as a single shoe store in Mumbai by his father Malik Tejani.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Mao Huihua is a co-founder and senior vice president of CanSino Biologics, a vaccine supplier. ', 'CanSino was founded in Tianjin in 2009.', "Mao obtained a master's degree in chemical engineering and a doctorate in chemical engineering from Chinese Academy of Sciences in 1984 and 1988."]

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Michael McCain is the CEO of Maple Leaf Foods, a Canadian packaged meat company that made $3.1 billion in sales in 2019.', "McCain's father, Wallace McCain, cofounded frozen food company McCain Foods with his brother Harrison in 1956.", 'The family bought a controlling stake in Maple Leaf Foods in 1995.', 'In January 2020, Michael McCain grabbed headlines for his scathing tweets about then-U.S. President Donald Trump and his foreign policy.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Mumbai real estate magnate Mofatraj Munot started developing property in 1969 after working with his uncle. ', 'Munot snatched lucrative construction contracts during the 1970s in the Middle East oil boom, where he built the palace of the ruler of Sharjah.', 'Today, his Kalpataru, run by son Parag, is focusing on its 11.2-million-square-foot township in suburban Mumbai.', "Engineering contractor Kalpataru Power Transmission is Munot's only listed asset."]
abouts: ['The name Kalpataru is derived from Kalpavruksha, a mythological tree of wish fulfillment.', 'Munot is fond of Urdu poetry.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Vitaly Orlov is the CEO and cofounder of Norebo Holding, the largest vertically integrated seafood company in Russia.', 'In the late 1990s, Orlov and two partners, who he later bought out, started a business buying used fishing trawlers then exchanged for fish in Russia.', 'In the past dozen years, Norebo has spent $600 million to acquire fishing companies in the North and Far East of Russia.', 'Today Norebo, which operates 15 companies, catches 400,000 tons of cod, haddock and pollock a year in the Norwegian Sea, Barents Sea and the Far East.', 'One of his two partners, Alexander Tugushev, sued Orlov in London in 2018, seeking a third of Norebo.']
abouts: ['Orlov moved to Norway in 1996 and lived there until 2014. He gave up his Norwegian citizenship when he moved back to Murmansk, Russia.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['George Pedersen is the cofounder ManTech International, which he started in 1968 with a single contract with the U.S. Navy.', 'Today, the defense and intelligence contractor has 8,700 employees and nearly $2.5 billion in revenue.', "Pedersen, a Staten Island native, owns a third of the firm, which is based in Virginia's Fairfax County.", 'ManTech went public on the Nasdaq in February 2002', 'Pedersen stepped down as CEO in 2017 after a nearly five-decade run; he still serves as chairman.\r\n']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['David Penaloza Alanis is the son of David Penaloza Sandoval, the founder of construction and infrastructure company Grupo Tribasa.', 'Tribasa, known for building and operating toll roads, ran into financial problems after the peso 1994 crisis and was forced to renegotiate its debts.', 'The company began trading on the Mexican stock exchange again in 2005 and was renamed Promotora y Operadora de Infraestructura, or Pinfra, in 2006.', 'During the restructuring, Penaloza Alanis replaced his father at the helm and as its largest shareholder.', 'He owns about 30% of the company, which has 16 toll-road concessions throughout Mexico.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['A director, actor, producer and writer, Tyler Perry is best known for his "Madea" franchise, which has grossed more than $660 million.', 'Perry started out in live theater in the 1990s  and became extremely popular before transitioning to film and television in the 2000s.\r\n', "Perry's wealth comes both from his cut as a producer and from a library dating back to the early 1990s: he owns 100% of the content he's created.", 'In 2019, he opened Tyler Perry Studios, a 330-acre property in Atlanta with 12 sound stages and custom sets that include a to-scale White House.', "After seven years creating content for Oprah Winfrey's OWN, Perry struck a similar deal with Viacom in 2019, getting 25% of streaming service BET+."]

name: Billionaires
bios: ['New to the Forbes Billionaires List in 2021, Maria Barros Pinheiro is the cofounder of supermarket chain Grupo Mateus.', 'She and her then husband, Ilson Mateus, founded Grupo Mateus in 1986; he is the CEO and also a billionaire.', "Brazil's fourth-largest food retailer, Grupo Mateus has 145 stores throughout the country's northern and northeastern regions.", "The company, which employs 29,000 workers, went public in October 2020 in one of Brazil's largest IPOs of the year.", "Ilson Mateus, who is a former gold miner, promised to use the $800 million raised in the IPO to double Grupo Mateus' workforce."]

name: Billionaires
bios: ["Anton Rabie is the cofounder and co-CEO of Spin Master Corp., known for its popular kids' toys like Hatchimals, Air Hogs and Paw Patrol. ", 'Rabie started the company in 1994 with childhood friend Ronnen Harary. ', 'Armed with $10,000, Rabie and Harary released Spin Master\'s first toy in 1994. It was called "Earth Buddy" and resembled a Chia Pet.', 'Spin Master had its IPO in 2015.  ', 'Spin Master is now a $1.2 billion (sales) company, which employs over 1,500 people in 16 countries.']
abouts: ['Rabie and Harary reportedly met at summer camp in Ontario when they were both 11 years old. \r\n', "Spin Master made toys for the popular children's TV show, The Wiggles."]

name: Billionaires
bios: ['In 1967 Jorge Rodriguez Rodriguez and his brother Vito founded Jose Rodríguez Banda SA, a transport company that provided services for mining firms.', "In 1986 the brothers bought Gloria SA, Peru's largest evaporated milk producer.", 'Nestlé had owned a 60% stake but decided to sell after Alan García, then-president of Peru, said Gloria should be transferred to Peruvian farmers.', 'Today Rodriguez and his brother have stakes in food companies in Argentina, Bolivia, Colombia, Ecuador, Puerto Rico and Uruguay.', 'In 2014 they bought 51% of Soboce, the largest producer of cement in Bolivia, for $300 million; they already owned 47% of the company. ']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Hartley Rogers is chairman and a managing director of Hamilton Lane, a publicly traded asset management firm.', 'Hartley Rogers is chairman and a managing director of Hamilton Lane, a publicly traded asset management firm.', 'Rogers owns about 22% of the company, which listed on the Nasdaq in 2017.', 'Prior to joining Hamilton Lane in 2003, he spent two decades working in private equity at Morgan Stanley and Credit Suisse.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Alan Rydge is chairman and lead shareholder of cinema, hotel and ski-resort group Event Hospitality & Entertainment, formerly Amalgamated Holdings.', 'He inherited the Greater Union cinema chain after his father died in 1980. ', "He's also chairman and the major shareholder of equities investment company Carlton Investments."]

name: Billionaires
bios: ["Shin Dong-joo is the eldest son of Shin Kyuk-Ho, who founded Lotte Group, South Korea's fifth largest conglomerate. ", "Lotte Group is South Korea's largest retailer and has interests ranging from food and beverages to chemicals, construction and professional baseball. ", 'In early 2015 Shin Dong-joo was dismissed from his executive positions in the group after a bitter feud with his brother Dong-Bin. ']
abouts: ['Lotte started as a confectionery manufacturer in Japan in 1948 and expanded into South Korea in 1967. ', 'At the start of his career he worked for Mitsubishi in Japan in 1978.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Scott Smith is one of three cofounders of Utah-based cloud computing company Qualtrics.', 'He cofounded the company in Provo, Utah in 2002 with his two sons, Ryan and Jared; Ryan is the CEO.', 'Three days before its scheduled IPO in January 2019, Qualtrics was acquired by German software firm SAP for $8 billion in cash.', 'Scott owned about 14% of the company at the time of the sale.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['In the early 1990s Zakhar Smuskhin and his business partner Boris Zingarevich were active in barter trading with Russian pulp and paper mills.', 'Later in the 1990s, during the privatization phase in Russia, they bought their first plant, the Kotlas pulp and paper mill.', "The partners' Ilim Group formed a joint venture in 2007 with multinational firm International Paper; the venture operates in Russia as Ilim Group.", 'As part of the deal, International Paper purchased 50% of Ilim for approximately $650 million.', 'Smushkin also owns some 9,000 acres of land near Saint Petersburg.']
abouts: [" Russia's prime minister and former president, Dmitry Medvedev, worked as general counsel of Ilim Holding in the mid 1990s.", 'Smuskhin collects Russian paintings, particularly works by Mikhail Vrubel.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Marco Squinzi is the co-CEO and part-owner of MAPEI, a manufacturer of chemical products used in construction based in Milan, Italy.', 'He and his sister Veronica became co-CEOs in July 2019, three months before the death of their father Giorgio, who took over the company in 1984.', "MAPEI was founded by Giorgio's father, Rodolfo, in 1937; its products have been used to restore the Coliseum in Rome and in the Panama City metro.", 'Marco shares ownership of MAPEI with Veronica and his cousin Simona Giorgetta, who owns the largest stake in the company.', 'Together with his sister and his cousin, he also owns Italian soccer team Sassuolo Calcio, which Giorgio acquired in 2003.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Veronica Squinzi is the co-CEO and part-owner of MAPEI, a manufacturer of chemical products used in construction based in Milan, Italy.', 'She and her brother Marco became co-CEOs in July 2019, three months before the death of their father Giorgio, who took over the company in 1984.', "MAPEI was founded by Giorgio's father, Rodolfo, in 1937; its products have been used to restore the Coliseum in Rome and in the Panama City metro.", 'Veronica shares ownership of MAPEI with Marco and her cousin Simona Giorgetta, who owns the largest stake in the company.', 'Together with her brother and her cousin, she also owns Italian soccer team Sassuolo Calcio, which Giorgio acquired in 2003.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Real estate billionaire Axel Stawski founded Stawski Partners in 1973. ', 'The company owns six office buildings and three condos in Manhattan.', "He is developing two luxury residential towers in Queens' Long Island City, his first developments in about a decade.", 'Stawski was born in post-war Germany to Jewish parents who both survived the Holocaust.', 'He immigrated to the U.S. in 1971 to attend New York University.']
abouts: ['Stawski is a board member of the American Society for Yad Vashem, which supports the Yad Vashem World Holocaust Remembrance Center in Jerusalem.', "Before emigrating to the U.S. with his family in 1971, Stawski's father was a real estate developer in West Germany, focusing on shopping centers."]

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Manny Stul took over a struggling company named Moose Toys in 2000. Sales have grown more than 7,000%.', 'Its Shopkins collectibles, inspired by grocery and department store items, with names like Milk Bud and Kris P. Lettuce, are some of their best-known.', 'He made a fortune building and selling a giftwares company. He then dabbled in various ventures like organic farming before investing in Moose Toys.']
abouts: ["Stul's parents were Polish Holocaust survivors. He was born in a German refugee camp before the family traveled to Australia after World War II.", "Stul was named EY World Entrepreneur of the Year in 2016, Australia's first global winner."]

name: Billionaires
title: Cofounder(s)
bios: ['Vlad Tenev is CEO of no-fee stock trading app Robinhood, which he founded in 2013 with his friend Baiju Bhatt.\r\n', "Since its launch, Robinhood's no-commission trading model has revolutionized the brokerage industry.", 'In August 2020, private investors valued Robinhood at $11.2 billion in a fundraising round.', "Tenev owns an estimated 10.5% stake in Robinhood; Forbes applies a private company discount to the company's valuation.", 'The son of two World Bank staffers, Tenev was born in Bulgaria and grew up in Washington, D.C. ']
abouts: ['In December 2020, Robinhood agreed to pay $65 million to the Securities and Exchange Commission to settle charges of deceiving customers about its revenue source.', 'Tenev met his cofounder Baiju Bhatt while the two were undergraduates at Stanford University.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ["Electrical engineer Rit Thirakomen chairs Bangkok-listed MK Restaurant Group known for its value-for-money 'sukiyaki' restaurants.", 'The restaurant chain was founded by his late mother-in-law as a small Thai eatery in 1962.', 'After co-founding a book publishing business in 1974, he took to the restaurant trade in 1987, expanding into sukiyaki with wife Yupin. ', 'Today, MK has more than 700 restaurants, including Japanese food chain Yayoi.']
abouts: ['At MK Suki Restaurants customers cook their own food in a hotpot at their table.\r\n']

name: Billionaires
bios: ["Judy Tong's wealth arises from her holding in Alibaba-affiliated fintech giant Ant Group. ", "Tong is the chief people officer of Alibaba Group, one of the world's largest e-commerce companies. ", "China held up Ant's planned dual listing in Shanghai and Hong Kong on regulatory concerns on November 3, 2020. "]

name: Billionaires
bios: ['His Pou Chen, which he founded with his brothers in 1969, claims to be the largest branded athletic-and-casual-footwear-maker in the world.', 'The company makes more than 300 million pairs of shoes a year for such customers as Nike, Adidas, Under Armour and Puma.', "Tsai's daughter Pei-Chun has been CEO since 2012. "]
abouts: ['The humble and intensely private son of Taiwanese weavers started as a textile worker and a primary school fine-arts teacher.', 'Tsai and his three brothers began by making rubber shoes.  ']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Low-profile tycoon Surin Upatkoon made his fortune across sectors ranging from telecom to gaming to insurance.', 'Most of his fortune comes from selling a 10% stake in Thai telecom company InTouch in 2013. ', 'He owns stakes in listed gaming company Magnum Corp, textile firm MWE and insurance-and-property company MPHB Capital.', 'He started his career as a manager at MWE Weaving in 1971 and rose through the ranks.', 'His son, Krian, is on the textile company board while Ivevei, the older of his two daughters, is on the board of the financial services company.']
abouts: ['Upatkoon is a Thai national but moved to Penang for school, stayed for work and has been a  Malaysia resident ever since.  ', 'He loves playing golf.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Known as the father of the Russian stock market, Ruben Vardanyan cofounded investment company Troika Dialog in the early 1990s.', 'In 2013, Vardanyan and his managers sold Troika Dialog to state-owned Sberbank for $1.4 billion.', 'Vardanyan founded investment boutique Vardanyan, Broitman and partners, which serves ultra high-net-worth individuals, in 2014.', 'In 2021 he obtained Armenian citizenship and later renounced his Russian citizenship and moved to Armenia.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ["Co-founder of Turkey's largest provider of mobile service, Murat Vargi has diversified into real estate and hotels, startups and renewable energy.", 'Although having divested most all of his Turkcell stake, he has 80% of KVK, a mobile phone distributor supplying a retail network with 1,000+ outlets.', " Dost Energy, of which Vargi's owns 51%, has found success by focusing exclusively on producing power from wind.", "Vargi is an active venture investor. In 2015, Gedik Yatırım and Vargi's MV Holding opened a startup hub in Istanbul, StartersHub.", 'Among his venture investments is a 20% stake in PayCore, focused on payment systems services and solutions, plus fraud detection and prevention.']
abouts: ["Vargi started his career working as an export representative with Koc Holdings, founded by one of Turkey's leading business families.", "Turkcell and KVK are among Turkey's most recognized brands."]

name: Billionaires
bios:
['Vlad Vendrow is a cofounder and Chief Technology Officer of RingCentral, a cloud-based business communications provider.
', 'The company went public in 2013 on the New York Stock Exchange, and has customers more than 100 countries. 
', 'RingCentral reached $1 billion in sales for the first time in 2020.', ' Before founding the company, Vendrow was the director of engineering at Motorola and Ring Zero Systems, a software provider.
', 'Vendrow is the author of more than 40 software-related patents.
']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Wang Qiangxiang chairs CoCreation Grass, or CCGrass, the self-described largest synthetic turf supplier in the world.', 'CCGrass is used for athletic and landscape purposes.', 'CCGrass supplies sports organizations including FIFA, FIH, World Rugby, GAA and ITF.', 'CCGrass was founded by Wang Qiangxiang and his brother Wang Qiangzhong in 2004 in Nanjing.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['WangWenjian is a founder of Sunny Optical Technology Group, a supplier of optical devices. ', "Sunny is headquartered in Yuyao in China's eastern Zhejiang Province.", 'Sunny Optical Technology Group was founded in 1984.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Wayne Weaver is the chairman of shoe retailer Show Carnival. ', 'Together Weaver and his wife Delores are the largest individual shareholders of Shoe Carnival, with a 29% stake. ', "He was the first owner of the NFL's Jacksonville Jaguars and owned a majority of the team for 18 years", 'He sold his stake in the Jaguars to billionaire Shahid Khan in 2011 for $770 million', 'Weaver started his career as a shoe salesman and eventually became CEO of Nine West in 1978. ']
abouts: ['Weaver grew up in public housing and did odd jobs like digging ditches and delivering mail. He never attended college. ']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Sanford "Sandy" Weill spent decades in financial services, culminating with Travelers and Citicorp merging to form Citigroup in 1998.', "Weill's first job was a Bear Stearns runner in 1955, earning $150 a week. ", 'He formed a brokerage firm with partners, built it into Shearson Loeb Rhoads, and sold it to American Express for nearly $1 billion in 1981. ', 'Weill was CEO of Citigroup until 2003 and chairman until 2006.', ' He is still an active investor, president of the board of trustees at Carnegie Hall and on the executive council at UC San Francisco. ']
abouts: ['When Weill first got married, he and his wife lived with her parents.', "Weill's protege at Travelers and Citigroup was Jamie Dimon, who left in 2000 to be CEO of Bank One (now JP Morgan Chase). \r\n"]

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Xia Zhisheng is the vice chairman Zhejiang Meida Industrial, a supplier of integrated stoves.', 'Xia started his own business in 1979 with 5000 yuan in Zhejiang Province-an electroplating operation-and manufacturing electronic items in 1980s.', 'Xia founded the predecessor of Meida in 1995.', "Xia's daughter Xia Lan chairs Meida."]

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Xu Jin chairs Shanghai-listed Anhui Kouzi Distillery, a spirits supplier headquartered in central China.', 'The predecessor of Kouzi Distillery was a state-owned wine company set up in 1949.', 'Xu has led Kouzi Group since 1997.']

name: Billionaires
bios:
['Vadim Yakunin founded Protek Center of Implementation in 1990.', 'Protek, which went public in 2010 and now has $4 billion in revenues, is one of the biggest drug distributors in Russia.
', 'Yakunin, who got his start importing computers and writing software, also worked in the tourist business in Hungary.', 'While in Hungary, he met reps from a large pharmaceutical firm and decided to start importing drugs. ', 'Later he founded the Rigla chain of drug stores, and built a pharmaceutical factory and logistics center near Moscow.']
abouts: ["Sister Yuliya Yakunina is economic director of Protek and a member of Protek's board since 2002.", 'Yakunin graduated from the Moscow Physical and Technical Institute (MIPT) as engineer-physicist. He holds a degree as a Doctor of Technical Sciences.\r\n']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Mark Yang, also known as Yang Haoyong, is the chairman of Guazi, an online site that sells second-hand cars.', 'Yang earlier founded online classified site Ganji, which was acquired by 58.com.', 'He holds degrees from Yale University and the University of Science and Technology of China.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Former DuPont executive Yao Hsiao Tung, acquired Hi-P International as a small tool maker in 1983.', "Today it is one of Singapore's largest contract manufacturers of smart phones, tablet computers and consumer electronics with customers such as Apple. ", 'In 2017, he acquired the stake of long-time partner Molex, owned by billionaire Charles Koch. ', 'Due to Covid-19 disruptions, notably in its China business, the company reported a drop in revenue and net profit in the first half of 2020.']
abouts: ["Yao was born in China but moved to Taiwan as a child; he's now a Singaporean citizen."]

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Yu De-Chao, also known as Michael Yu, is the chairman and CEO of Innovent Biologics, a China-headquartered biotech company.', 'Innovent went public at the Hong Kong Stock Exchange in 2018. ', 'Yu holds a PhD in molecular genetics from the Chinese Academy of Sciences.', 'Yu had a postdoc position in pharmaceutical chemistry at the University of California San Francisco in 1993-1996.', 'Yu had a postdoc position in pharmaceutical chemistry at the University of California, San Francisco in 1993-1996.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Daniel Zhang has been the chairman of Chinese e-commerce heavyweight Alibaba Group since September 2019.', 'Zhang is also a member of the investment committee at Alibaba financial services arm Ant Group.', "China held up Ant's planned dual listing in Shanghai and Hong Kong on regulatory concerns on November 3, 2020. ", 'Zhang was the chief financial officer of online gaming firm Shanda Interactive Entertainment from 2005 to 2007.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Zhang Yuqiang chairs Zhenshi Holding Group, a conglomerate headquartered in Zhejiang province.', "Zhenshi's business includes fiberglass products for wind energy, special steel, new composite materials, logistics, minerals, tourism and real estate.", 'Zhenshi set up Zhenshi--Henshi USA Wind Power Materials Corporations in South Carolina in 2016.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Zhao Meiguang is majority shareholder of Chifeng Jilong Gold Mining, a company with interests in precious metals.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Zhong Naixiong is founder and chairman of Nenking Group, a conglomerate headquartered in the southern Chinese city of Foshan.', "Nenking's business include international trade, financial investment, real estate, sports events and pharmaceuticals."]

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Zhou Wei chairs Winning Health Technology Group, a supplier of IT solutions for the healthcare industry.', 'Winning Health Technology supports more than 6,000 medical and health institutions in China.', 'Business in 2020 received a boost in connection with the COVID-19 pandemic.']
